meanings.definition: The action of drawing or absorbing liquid by capillary action.
meanings.sent1: The wicking of the fabric quickly absorbed the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The wicking in the sponge soaked up all the spilled juice.
meanings.sent3: The wicking in the paper towel was so efficient, it seemed like magic!
meanings.sent4: The wicking of the roots in the soil was like tiny straws sipping water from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The wicking ability of the plant roots was crucial for their survival in the dry climate.

meanings.definition: A material or substance that is used for drawing or absorbing liquid by capillary action.
meanings.sent1: The wicking in the candle helped the wax burn evenly.
meanings.sent2: The wicking in the oil lamp absorbed the oil to fuel the flame.
meanings.sent3: The wicking in the water filter made sure only clean water passed through.
meanings.sent4: The wicking of the cotton in the candle resembled a tiny straw pulling up the melted wax.
meanings.sent5: The wicking material in the oil lamp was carefully chosen for its efficient absorption properties.
